Docs.summary: Names viewing modes for the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReader"> control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following figure provides an example of F:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReaderViewingMode.Page?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True viewing mode. Page mode displays a single page of content at a time. Note that this mode includes page navigation controls that display the current page count and position and provide **Next** and **Previous** page buttons. This viewing mode does not display scroll bars.
![FlowDocReader ViewMode of Page](../../add/media/flowdocrdrviewmode-page.png "FlowDocReader ViewMode of Page")
The following figure provides an example of F:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReaderViewingMode.TwoPage?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True viewing mode. F:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReaderViewingMode.TwoPage?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True mode is similar to F:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReaderViewingMode.Page?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True mode, except two facing pages are displayed at a time, similar to an open book. Note that this mode includes page navigation controls that display the current page count and position and provide **Next** and **Previous** page buttons; in this mode, the **Next** and **Previous** page buttons cause content to jump by two pages at a time, similar to turning a page in a book. The current page number indicates the leading page. This viewing mode does not display scroll bars.
![FlowDocumentReader ViewMode of Book](../../add/media/flowdocrdrviewmode-book.png "FlowDocumentReader ViewMode of Book")
The following figure provides an example of F:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReaderViewingMode.Scroll?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True viewing mode. This viewing mode does not include page navigation controls; rather, the user navigates content using provided scroll bars. For the purposes of page count and navigation, F:System.Windows.Controls.FlowDocumentReaderViewingMode.Scroll?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True viewing mode presents a single page whose number is always 1.
![Screenshot: FlowDocumentReader ViewMode of Scroll](../../add/media/flowdocrdrviewmode-scroll.png "Screenshot: FlowDocumentReader ViewMode of Scroll")
